intro: Lomatium angustatum, commonly known as narrowleaf lomatium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. It has a taproot system and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Lomatium angustatum is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
